metadata.synopsis: Friends defy the rules of a legendary murderer and discover he is real when they start celebrating Valentine's Day.

reviews: Far from the best horror film, and far from the best slasher, there is something classically endearing about My Bloody Valentine.
At least the film gets right into the killing, starting with the unlikely victim of an old lady.
MY BLOODY VALENTINE still stands the test of time almost 40 years later.
The splatter of blood and guts never becomes redundant.
Here are three things this film gets right: the characters, the location, and the kills.
While I have a great amount of love for the slasher subgenre as a whole, there's a real charm to My Bloody Valentine (1981) that makes it a standout amongst its cinematic peers.
Lacking even an ounce of imagination, this is no better and maybe just a little bit worse than most of the era's like-minded fare.
A genuinely creepy genre entry that successfully evokes the atmosphere of timeless folklore...
My Bloody Valentine doesn't get many things right. [Full Review in Spanish]
For those in the know: My Bloody Valentine is one of the great slashers, and it's a fun, grisly time.

Director George Mihalka gets effectively naturalistic performances out of his leads, as well as an intermittently eerie mood, but ultimately, it's a movie enjoyed more for what it could've been than what it actually is.
If you're looking for a good movie to watch this Valentine's Day or just a good slasher movie, this one is great!
This film is slightly better than most slice-and-dice efforts and contains several genuine surprises.
[Has] a sense of place matched by literally no other slasher film I have seen.
Old-school slasher film is too gory for kids.
The dialogue is laugh-out-loud hilarious at times, and you've gotta love the dated tunes and far-out fashions.
sick, twisted, and guaranteed to leave you numb, or nauseous, or both
As far as slashers go, My Bloody Valentine is fairly standard stuff. And yet, the film contains a pleasing atmosphere, turning a day dedicated to love into a day to be feared.
Quickly devolves into a piece of hackwork.
